gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Random stratified research survey conducted to monitor distribution and abundance of fish and invertebrates available to a bottom otter trawl at depths from 15 fm to 400 fm. Data collected include total catch in numbers and weight by species, length frequency for all fish and selected invertebrates, ageing materials, individual specimen weight, sex and maturity stages, and additional specimen collections as requested (eg genetic material, stomach content data, specimens for museums and schools). Also some stomachs collected and analysis done at sea, or by the Stomach Database. Otoliths collected and sent to the Ageing database. Some specimens frozen entire and provided to Atlantic Reference Center for taxonomic validation. Coral Samples collected provided to various coral researchers at Bedford Institute of Oceanography.
The data available via the ESRI REST service has been limited to the standardized numbers and weights for those species that have been reliably identified throughout the data series (n=63). The standardization process is the process of finding the ratio of the actual towed distance with the standard tow distance, and apply that same ratio to the numbers and weights.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Primary source of information for Stock Assessments Used for determining distributions and abundances Research

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString:
Following is the Data Dictionary/Field Names and Descriptions for the associated GIS service: Field Names: Description OBJECTID: <ArcGIS Field> Shape: <ArcGIS Field> Stratum: A numeric code to identify stratum. Mission: A 10 character field to identify the survey. SurveyYear: Year taken from the SurveyDate Season: Spring (Jan-Apr), Summer (May-Aug) or Fall (Sept-Dec) SurveyDate: The local date and standard time at the beginning of the tow. SetNumber: Each tow is assigned a numeric set identifier starting with 1 for the first tow and then assigned consecutively. Distance_NM: The actual tow distance in nautical miles. Longitude_DD: The longitude at the start of a tow recorded in decimal degrees. Latitude_DD: The latitude at the start of a tow recorded in decimal degrees. Gear: Gear Description. SurfaceTemperature_C: Surface Temperature in celsius. BottomTemperature_C: Bottom Temperature in celsius. BottomSalinity_PSU: Bottom salinity measured in pounds per square unit. MinimumDepth_Fathoms: The minimum(shallowest) bottom depth, in fathoms. MaximumDepth_Fathoms: The maximum(deepest) bottom depth, in fathoms. Species: DFO Species code. TaxonomicSerialNumber: ITIS Taxonomic Serial Number. ScientificName: The Scientific Name for this TSN according to ITIS. TaxonomicNameAuthor: The author associated with the name according to ITIS. TotalNumberStandardized: Total Weight of individuals in kgs, standardized by a 1.75 NM tow. TotalWeightStandardized_KG: Total weight in kilograms.
Monitoring Program Element:Lower Trophic Levels - Benthic Invertebrates, shrimp and squid Higher Trophic Levels - Fish Physical/Chemical Environment - Hydrographic data (depth, temperature, salinity) AZMP sampling conducted since 1999
Database components: Detailed sampling data from the Research Vessel Ecosystem surveys
Publications: Chadwick, E. M. P., W. Brodie, E. Colbourne, D. Clark, D. Gascon, and T. Hurlbut. 2007. History of annual multi-species trawl surveys on the Atlantic Coast of Canada. AZMP Bulletin 6: 25-42.
Clark, D. S. and J. Emberley. 2008. Summer Scotian Shelf and Bay of Fundy Ecosystem update for 2008. CSAS Res Doc 2009/017
Clark, D. S. and P. Perley. 2006. Summer Scotian Shelf and Bay of Fundy Ecosystem update 2006. CSAS Res Doc 2006/20; 53 p.
Tremblay, M.J.; Black, G.A.P.; Branton, R.M., 2007. The distribution of common decapod crustaceans and other invertebrates recorded in annual ecosystem surveys of the Scotian Shelf 1999-2006. Canadian technical report of fisheries and aquatic sciences; 2762; 74 p.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Data are entered at sea during actual work and sampling. Data are entered using an in-house developed application, groundfish Surveys Entry system (GSE) which includes rigorous quality assurance checks at time of entry. The majority of errors are corrected at time of sampling. Further quality assurance checks are done before load into the production database.
Any errors noted during data exploration or analysis should be reported to the custodian for correction of the data.
